line_1: On Dun, the old sure-footed mare,
line_2: For had you laid this brittle ware

line_1: Old Dobbin, or the founder'd mare;
line_2: And buckles to his one-horse chair,
When frisking forth to take the air:

line_1: And look as wise as Moss's mare,
line_2: Then you shall see him stamp and stare,
